name.description: The name of the NetApp Volume. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group where the NetApp Volume should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

account_name.description: The name of the NetApp account in which the NetApp Pool should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

volume_path.description: A unique file path for the volume. Used when creating mount targets. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

pool_name.description: The name of the NetApp pool in which the NetApp Volume should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

service_level.description: The target performance of the file system. Valid values include `Premium`, `Standard`, or `Ultra`.

protocols.description: The target volume protocol expressed as a list. Supported single value include `CIFS`, `NFSv3`, or `NFSv4.1`. If argument is not defined it will default to `NFSv3`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created and data will be lost.

subnet_id.description: The ID of the Subnet the NetApp Volume resides in, which must have the `Microsoft.NetApp/volumes` delegation. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

storage_quota_in_gb.description: The maximum Storage Quota allowed for a file system in Gigabytes.

export_policy_rule.description: One or more `export_policy_rule` block defined below.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

rule_index.description: The index number of the rule.

allowed_clients.description: A list of allowed clients IPv4 addresses.

protocols_enabled.description: A list of allowed protocols. Valid values include `CIFS`, `NFSv3`, or `NFSv4.1`. Only one value is supported at this time. This replaces the previous arguments: `cifs_enabled`, `nfsv3_enabled` and `nfsv4_enabled`.

unix_read_only.description: Is the file system on unix read only?

unix_read_write.description: Is the file system on unix read and write?

id.description: The ID of the NetApp Volume.

create.description: Used when creating the NetApp Volume.

update.description: Used when updating the NetApp Volume.

read.description: Used when retrieving the NetApp Volume.

delete.description: Used when deleting the NetApp Volume.
